implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. Enables users to view the list of tasks, which is essential for managing and displaying tasks.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define GET /tasks endpoint
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives all required fields and passes them to the database layer for creation.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define POST /tasks endpoint
    Receive TaskCreate object (title, description, priority, due_date, ...)
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for creating and saving a new task. Ensures a unique ID is assigned and persists the task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create new Task with unique id and provided fields
Append new task to tasks list
Save tasks to file
Return new task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated fields and passes them to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define PUT /tasks/{task_id} endpoint
    Receive task_id and TaskCreate object
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If not found, raise 404
    Return updated task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles updating an existing task with new data. Finds the task by ID, updates fields, and saves.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
For each task:
    If task.id == task_id:
        Create updated Task with new data
        Replace old task with updated task
        Save tasks to file
        Return updated task
If not found, return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task. Calls the database layer to remove the task by ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define DELETE /tasks/{task_id} endpoint
    Receive task_id
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not found, raise 404
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles removing a task from the list and saving the updated list.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Filter out the task with matching id
If a task was removed:
    Save tasks to file
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

implementation.name: Task, TaskCreate, TaskBase
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the data structure for tasks, including required fields (title, description, priority, due_date, completed). Used for validation and serialization.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define TaskBase with fields:
    title: str
    description: Optional[str]
    priority: Priority
    due_date: Optional[date]
    completed: bool
TaskCreate inherits TaskBase
Task inherits TaskBase and adds id: str

missing_implementations: When adding a task, the following fields must be provided: title, description, priority, due date. (description and due_date are Optional in the model, so not strictly enforced as required on creation)

Mark tasks as Pending (the only field is 'completed', so explicit marking as Pending is not a distinct operation; setting completed=False is possible, but no dedicated endpoint or function for toggling Pending/Completed)
